metadata.Title: CVE-2011-1784 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The pidfile_write function in core/pidfile.c in keepalived 1.2.2 and earlier uses 0666 permissions for the (1) keepalived.pid, (2) checkers.pid, and (3) vrrp.pid files in /var/run/, which allows local users to kill arbitrary processes by writing a PID to one of these files.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-1784` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

keepalived - 1:1.2.24-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: keepalived package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.2.24-1ubuntu0.16.04.1').
